name: Aquarius

definition: Aquarius is one of the zodiac constellations along the ecliptic (the Sun’s apparent path). The Water Bearer. Represents Ganymede, cup-bearer to the gods. Best seen around October. Approximate sky region: RA: 18–24h (S).
historyShort: Known since antiquity and traditionally listed among the classical constellations described by Ptolemy (2nd century). Modern boundaries are standardized by the IAU.

historyShort: Known since antiquity and traditionally listed among the classical constellations described by Ptolemy (2nd century). Modern boundaries are standardized by the IAU.

historyShort: Known since antiquity and traditionally listed among the classical constellations described by Ptolemy (2nd century). Modern boundaries are standardized by the IAU.
